block.p: Shawni Modrell, a film editor, and Jeffrey Astrof, a television producer and writer, are to be married this evening at Casa Del Mar, a hotel in Santa Monica, Calif. Rabbi Neal Weinberg is to officiate.

The bride formerly acted on television and, until recently, was a film editor for ''Freaks and Geeks,'' a comedy that appeared on NBC. She graduated from the California Institute of the Arts in Valencia. She is a daughter of Dwanee and Larry Modrell of Springfield, Ore. Her father, who is retired, was the assistant principal of Page Elementary School in Springfield, where he also taught the fourth grade. Her mother is the administrative director of the Mrs. Oregon International Pageant in Eugene, Ore.

Shawni Modrell, a film editor, and Jeffrey Astrof, a television producer and writer, are to be married this evening at Casa Del Mar, a hotel in Santa Monica, Calif. Rabbi Neal Weinberg is to officiate.

The bride formerly acted on television and, until recently, was a film editor for ''Freaks and Geeks,'' a comedy that appeared on NBC. She graduated from the California Institute of the Arts in Valencia. She is a daughter of Dwanee and Larry Modrell of Springfield, Ore. Her father, who is retired, was the assistant principal of Page Elementary School in Springfield, where he also taught the fourth grade. Her mother is the administrative director of the Mrs. Oregon International Pageant in Eugene, Ore.
Mr. Astrof was a writer on ''Friends'' and an executive producer of ''Veronica's Closet,'' the NBC comedies. He is developing a new comedy series for Warner Brothers Television in Burbank, Calif.

The bridegroom graduated from the University of Pennsylvania. His parents, Catherine and Lester Astrof, live in Massapequa Park, N.Y., where they own and manage Fitzgerald Properties, a real estate brokerage firm.
The couple met in 1998 while working on an ABC comedy, ''It's Like, You Know,'' for which the bride was a film editor and the bridegroom an executive producer.
